channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Carney Unveils Major Projects for Canada to Offset Damage of Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney unveiled big infrastructure plans. But they are likely to meet resistance from Indigenous and environmental groups.

item.title: Nadine Menendez, Wife of a Senator, Sentenced to 4 1/2 Years for Bribery Scheme
item.description: “The blindfold is off,” she said about her husband, Robert Menendez, a former senator. “I now know he is not my savior. He is not the man I thought he...

item.title: Can a New York City Mayoral Candidate Be Taken Off the Ballot?
item.description: A judge affirmed a Board of Elections decision that it was too late for Jim Walden to be taken off the New York City mayoral ballot. The same would be...

item.title: Why the founder CEO of $22 billion Ramp tracks every single day his unicorn startup has been in existence
item.description: Two thousand three hundred and sixty-seven days. Exactly.

item.title: Student Who Shot 2 Others at Colorado School Was ‘Radicalized,’ Officials Say
item.description: Desmond Holly, 16, who is suspected of shooting and critically injuring two students, had been “radicalized by an extremist network,” the authorities ...

item.title: Opendoor brings back its founders plus a new CEO from Shopify—who could earn $2.8 billion if he sends the stock soaring
item.description: If Kaz Netjatian can clear all the performance hurdles in his compensation package, he’ll own 11.6% of the tech company.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Was Practicing Politics the Right Way
item.description: The foundation of a free society is the ability to participate in politics without fear of violence. To lose that is to risk losing everything.

item.title: Carney Unveils Major Projects for Canada to Offset Damage of Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney unveiled big infrastructure plans. But they are likely to meet resistance from Indigenous and environmental groups.

item.title: Brazil’s Supreme Court Is On Course to Convict Bolsonaro in Coup Plot
item.description: A majority of voting justices said they plan to vote to convict Brazil’s former president of trying to hold onto power. A final verdict could come Thu...

item.title: Bolsonaro Convicted of Attempting a Coup in Brazil
item.description: Brazil’s Supreme Court convicted the former president of trying to cling to power after losing the 2022 election, in a plot that included killing his ...

item.title: U.K. Ambassador to U.S., Peter Mandelson, Fired Over Epstein Links
item.description: The British government said it withdrew the envoy after newly revealed emails showed the depth of his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Drone Barrage Over Poland Was a Test for NATO, and the U.S.
item.description: A continent already on edge over the Ukraine war sees a Russian challenge to NATO readiness and to an America that wants to disengage from Europe.

item.title: $16 billion Twilio CEO wakes at 4:30 a.m., works Sundays and runs laps around his house between meetings to blow off steam
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Running a $16 billion company looks like 4:30 a.m. starts, working on Sundays and running laps around the house to blow off steam—and Twili...

item.title: Third Space’s CEO follows an 80/20 rule for eating out, competes in triathlons at 54-years-old and made startup investments he regrets
item.description: Third Space CEO’s worst investment? “A handful of startups that have gone bust…”

item.title: Step aside, LinkedIn: Grindr CEO says he has hired workers through the dating app, as the company pitches itself as the new networking platform in town
item.description: Users checking into the dating app to see how many feet they are from a potential love interest can now expect to be poached, rather than asked out.
